Our Mission - River Action UK Skip to content Campaigns News About Our Mission Our Impact Our Team Our Supporters Contact Join Us Take action Donate Campaigns Agriculture Sewage Influencing Policy News About Our Mission Our Impact Our Team Our Supporters Contact Join Us Take action Donate Campaigns Influencing Policy Agriculture Sewage Latest View All Independent Water Commission View campaign River Thames Campaign View campaign Our Mission & Strategy We‚Äôre on a mission to rescue Britain‚Äôs rivers Rivers are the lifeblood of our land. Their health is intertwined with our health as individuals and communities, and with¬† humanity as a whole. We would not be here without them, and we are dependent on their survival. Our rivers¬† are facing an environmental calamity, caused by a deluge of pollution and over-abstraction. We believe however, that¬† this can be reversed and they can be returned to their rightful, vibrant health. The Problem Our rivers are in crisis - they are¬† dying and our very life line¬†is at risk. All Britain‚Äôs rivers are polluted. In England, only 14% of rivers have ‚Äògood‚Äô ecological status and zero have good chemical status. Climate-change driven floods and droughts combined with polluted water threaten communities‚Äô health and water supply. Simultaneously, the government agencies tasked with monitoring and regulating rivers have been defunded so polluters profiteer with impunity. River Action was founded to tackle this crisis. We have devised a solution that goes to the root causes of the problem, using a holistic approach to cascade urgent systemic change across the country. Our Solution Our approach is grounded in community-leadership, natural systems and collaborative action. Our five-year strategy has three overarching goals: 1. Empower local communities: Provide communities and activists with a toolkit that enables them to rescue their local river catchments. Enable citizen science groups and NGOs to collect evidence of pollution levels such as excess nutrients and dangerous bacteria. 2. Mobilise public opinion: Raise public awareness through creative and original content designed to go viral, gain maximum exposure in the national media, and amplify activists‚Äô voices. Leverage this awareness to influence the Government and polluting industries through petitions, boycotts, shareholder actions and positive direct engagement between stakeholders. 3. Advocate government policy and industry practice change: Drive government policy enforcement of regulations through taking legal action against the relevant government bodies and creating a charter of best practices for rivers to expedite reform in regulation, incentivise sustainable water management and to enforce the law. Catalyse behaviour change in polluting industries to adopt river-friendly practices by presenting them with evidence of the pollution they are causing, pressuring urgent investment in outdated infrastructure, offering nature-based solutions, and leveraging consumer and stakeholder support. Scroll Down WHO WE ARE We build capacity for communities, students, and future leaders to advocate for nature, climate, and equity on the Los Angeles River. Learn More Impact Not long ago, most Angelenos didn‚Äôt even realize a River ran through their city. For almost 40 years, FoLAR has been working to change that. We make the LA River healthier, greener, and more accessible by restoring habitat, educating the next generation, and advocating for a future where both people and wildlife can thrive. Learn More Advocate The LA River is an iconic landmark, a vital resource, and a powerful tool for climate resilience. Stretching from Canoga Park to Long Beach, it connects communities across the city. FoLAR is working to ensure the River thrives and remains accessible to all Angelenos. Learn More Support With your help, we can keep the LA River healthy, accessible, and full of life. Through community events, education, and advocacy, we are working to protect and restore the River‚Äîbut we can‚Äôt do it without you. Learn More Explore Whether you are kayaking, birdwatching, or just taking it all in, there are plenty of ways to connect with the River. FoLAR provides maps, field guides, and resources to help you discover everything the River has to offer. Learn More SIGN UP & STAY IN TOUCH SUBSCRIBE WHAT WE DO BRINGING THE LA RIVER TO LIFE FoLAR restores habitat, advocates for smart policy, and connects people to the LA River through education, community events, and hands-on action. K-12 Education FoLAR‚Äôs education programs bring the LA River into classrooms and students into the River, fostering the next generation of environmental stewards through hands-on learning and exploration. Community Events FoLAR‚Äôs events connect people to the LA River through shared experiences that inspire action, learning, and a deeper appreciation for this vital resource. Advocacy & Policy FoLAR works to ensure the LA River‚Äôs future is shaped by policies that prioritize ecological health, equitable access, and climate resilience, amplifying community voices in the decision-making process. Great LA River CleanUp Every year, thousands of volunteers join together to remove trash from the LA River, making it the largest urban river cleanup in the country and a powerful act of community-driven restoration.
